metadata.title: CVE-2021-27364 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.11.3.drivers/scsi/scsi_transport_iscsi.c is adversely affected by the ability ofan unprivileged user to craft Netlink messages.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27364` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-206-generic - 4.4.0-206.238
linux-image-4.4.0-206-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-206.238
linux-image-4.4.0-206-lowlatency - 4.4.0-206.238
linux-image-4.4.0-206-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-206.238
linux-image-4.4.0-206-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-206.238
linux-image-4.4.0-206-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-206.238
linux-image-4.4.0-206-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-206.238
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-206-generic - 4.4.0-206.238
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-206-lowlatency - 4.4.0-206.238
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-139-generic - 4.15.0-139.143~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-139-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-139.143~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-139-lowlatency - 4.15.0-139.143~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-139-generic - 4.15.0-139.143~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-139-lowlatency - 4.15.0-139.143~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1090-kvm - 4.4.0-1090.99
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1124-aws - 4.4.0-1124.138
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1096-aws - 4.15.0-1096.103~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1110-azure - 4.15.0-1110.122~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1095-gcp - 4.15.0-1095.108~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1067-oracle - 4.15.0-1067.75~16.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-206.238').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-139.143~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.99').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.138').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1096.103~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1110.122~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1095.108~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1067.75~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1148.158').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1152.162').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
